content.description: Climb up the steep wall on the left of the dihedral.  The climbing at the start is good with fun face and crack moves.  Two bolts below the anchors the climb changes and needs thought before making your move up to the anchors.

climbs.name: Mayfly
climbs.fa: Margy Marshall, K. Cordner, D. Olson

content.description:
vertical face to arete to easy face to cool rock over finish.

crux is above 10th bolt.  If you go straight over at the 5th bolt instead of wrapping around the arete the route is more like 10b/c with that being the crux.
Start on a giant undercling flake to face climbing to a confusing left vs right, arete vs dihedral conundrum. Which way? We don’t know.
content.location: Directly to the right of Snapping Pussy Doll.

climbs.name: Jizz Soaked Action Pix
climbs.fa: Mike Strassman, Scott Ayers, Eden Masters, 1991

content.description:
Start up the slab passing a low bolt that protects a tricky move left. Continue up the easy slab to the second bolt and the start of the face.

Follow the line of bolts up the slab via thin edges to a tricky section at mid Height.

The route is spoilt at the top as it nears it's neighbor on the right. Stay true to the line and go direct onto the slab then traverse delicately rightwards to the anchors.
content.location: Steep face Middle of the area

content.description: This slabby rig at the top of the talus slope was a victim(?) of retrobolting.  Unfortunately the bolts and line wander back and forth so much, you're liable to feel the rope drag unless you use long runners.  Regardless, the climbing is fun and involves slab moves between good stances.  Might feel a bit sporty (especially to the first bolt) if 5.8 is your limit.

climbs.name: Hey Amigo
climbs.fa: Brian Treanor, Bill MacBride, Andre Gharagozian, 1994

content.description: Start up the steep broken dihedral.   As the crack opens steepmup and right and follow the rightwards slanting crack up the the anchors.

A steep route with good positions.

Easy crack to a ramp then right and up steep section (crux) to a way fun cruise up the face to the anchor.
content.protection: Five bolts, and two mussy hooks.
content.location: A recess on the left of the crag.

content.description: Up the arete past a cam to a bolt and the crux,then cruising up the arete first on the right then taking the path of least resistance, whatever that may be.
content.protection: One inch cam, four bolts, two mussy hooks. EDIT: 7 bolts no cam needed.

content.description: Retro bolted by Kelly Cordner and Derick Olson.  Shares first two bolts with Stonefly.  Super fun corner climbing. Keeps you thinking. Crux is above the 5th bolt.
crux is around the 6th bolt.  crack to vertical face to slab.  beyond buckets near the crux

Steep and pumpy.

Up a groove to a step right and steepness, easily to the face, then more intricate with a fierce pull just before an easing and the anchor.
content.protection: Eight bolts to four bolt anchor, two of them mussy hooks.
content.location: Steep face right of Cat in the Hat.
